com.biorecorder.edflib

Class EdfWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.biorecorder.edflib.DataRecordsWriter
      • com.biorecorder.edflib.EdfWriter

  • public class EdfWriter
extends DataRecordsWriter
    Class for writing DataRecords to the EDF or BDF File. It creates a file if it does not exist. Already existing file with the same name will be silently overwritten without advance warning!!

    To make it possible to write DataRecords to the file, we must open the EdfWriter first and pass a HeaderConfig object with the configuration information for the file header record. That is, call the method open(HeaderConfig). Only after that DataRecords and samples could be written correctly.

    We may write digital or physical DataRecords and samples. Every physical (floating point) value will be converted to the corresponding digital (int) value using physical maximum, physical minimum, digital maximum and digital minimum of the signal.

    Every digital (int) value is converted to 2 LITTLE_ENDIAN ordered bytes (16 bits) for EDF files or to 3 LITTLE_ENDIAN ordered bytes (24 bits) for BDF files and in this form written to the file.

    See Also:
    DataRecordsWriter, EdfWriter

        Parameters:
        file - the file to be opened for writing
        fileType - type of the file: EDF (16 bits) or BDF (24 bits)

    • Method Detail

      • setDurationOfDataRecordsComputable

        public void setDurationOfDataRecordsComputable(boolean isComputable)
        If true the average duration of DataRecords during writing process will be calculated and the result will be written to the file header.

        average duration of DataRecords = (time of coming last DataRecord - time of coming first DataRecord) / total number of DataRecords

        Parameters:
        isComputable - - if true duration of DataRecords will be calculated

      • open

        public void open(HeaderConfig headerConfig)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: DataRecordsWriter
        Prepare the DataRecords writer for correct work. This function MUST be called before writing any data. After opening the configuration of the writer SHOULD NOT be changed.
        Overrides:
        open in class DataRecordsWriter
        Parameters:
        headerConfig - - object with the information about DataRecords structure
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeDigitalDataRecord

        public void writeDigitalDataRecord(int[] digitalData,
                                   int offset)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Write ONE digital DataRecord to the file. Take data from digitalData array starting at offset position. Every int is converted to LITTLE_ENDIAN ordered bytes (2 bytes for EDF files and 3 bytes for BDF files).
        Specified by:
        writeDigitalDataRecord in class DataRecordsWriter
        Parameters:
        digitalData - array with digital data
        offset - offset within the array at which the DataRecord starts
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: DataRecordsWriter
        Closes this writer and releases any system resources associated with it. This writer may no longer be used for writing DataRecords. This method MUST be called after finishing writing DataRecords. Failing to do so will cause unnessesary memory usage and corrupted and incomplete data writing.
        Specified by:
        close in class DataRecordsWriter
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getWritingInfo

        public java.lang.String getWritingInfo()
        Get info about writing process: start recording time, stop recording time, number of written DataRecords, average duration of DataRecords.
        Returns:
        string with info about writing process
